intro: Trichoneura hirtella, commonly known as the hairy trichoneura, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, which includes a wide variety of orchids. The plant is characterized by its compact stature and distinctive hairy foliage, which gives it its common name. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, often displaying a range of colors from white to pale pink. Trichoneura hirtella thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
